channel.title: Hooking the NPC Class?
channel.description: Any advice on locating [i]NPC[/i]? Right now, I'm using the dirtiest way: modifiers, superclass & instance field count, and although it works, it makes me rage. I just can't find anything better; offer me some tips? :rolleyes:

item.title: Hooking the NPC Class?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:14, topic:323058”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=419463.msg3131508#msg3131508 date=1266543531]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=419463.msg3131473#msg3131473 date=1266540747]

what I do is I’ve already hooked the player class, and from that all the supers(mobile, animable, entity). So I go through all the classes and look for one that has Mobile as super, and doesn’t equals the player class
[/quote]Dependant ‘hooks’ are not a very good idea.

I heard NPC and Players are no longer Character’s, true story.
[/quote]I wasn’t implying that they would ever change, idiot, I was implying that when the identification of the ‘Player’ class fails, so will the identification of the ‘NPC’ class.[/quote]

but it takes much less work to do dependent than to create separate ways of finding them, specially if its such a sure thing as being the only 2 classes which are under the Character class

Read full topic

item.title: Hooking the NPC Class?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

tenen

getstatic vh/s [Loe; getstatic mh/e [I
the first should be local npc list and the second should be local npc pointers

Read full topic

item.title: Hooking the NPC Class?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

it contains the indexes which have a value since the NPC array and the Player array dont have all the objects inside filled in an organized manner, like :

Array {“blah”, null, “blah”, null, null, null “blah” }
Index {0, 2, 6}
Count 3

those are the three things you look for regarding players and npcs, the array, the index array, and the count if im not mistaking all three can be found with the debug

Read full topic

item.title: Hooking the NPC Class?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Metho D, post:5, topic:323058”]“gnp2 pos:”

is probably what you’re looking for.[/quote]
“gnp2”?

getstatic vh/s [Loe;
getstatic mh/e [I
iload_3
iaload
aaload
ifnonnull 117
new java/lang/RuntimeException
dup
new java/lang/StringBuffer
dup
ldc "gnp2 pos:"
invokespecial java/lang/StringBuffer/<init>(Ljava/lang/String;)V
iload_3
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(I)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
ldc " size:"
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
getstatic jo/m I
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(I)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/toString()Ljava/lang/String;
invokespecial java/lang/RuntimeException/<init>(Ljava/lang/String;)V
athrow

class oe is looking good

oksuper_:

what the fuck do you think an index is for… ?

no clue in this case

Read full topic

item.title: Hooking the NPC Class?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Nueb35:

and the array (and index array?)

what’s the index array’s purpose? I’ve seen in outputs static int[] getNPCIndicies() but have no clue what it’s for

edit:
i searched all ldc instructions for “npc” and got this:

jg.a(Ljava/lang/String;ZZ)V - nonpcs
jg.a(Ljava/lang/String;ZZ)V - nonpcs=
lp.a(II[Lnk;BIIIIII)V -  npc:

the first two weren’t that handy (they weren’t a debug), but the last one seemed interesting. but, looking at the code, i couldn’t find an object array nor an int array. here’s the code:

new java/lang/StringBuffer
dup
ldc "Ls: "
invokespecial java/lang/StringBuffer/<init>(Ljava/lang/String;)V
getstatic ub/cb I
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(I)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
ldc " La: "
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
getstatic ss/e I
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(I)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
ldc " NPC: "
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
getstatic vt/d I
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(I)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
ldc " Pl: "
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
getstatic kk/d I
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/append(I)Ljava/lang/StringBuffer;
invokevirtual java/lang/StringBuffer/toString()Ljava/lang/String;
iconst_0
sipush 65280

it pushes an int, so maybe this is the NPC count?

Read full topic

@nueb35 wrote:

npc position debug output, there you will find the npc class, and the array (and index array?), its like "pnpc: ", same for player although i cant remember the exact string
